sentences: Ei suuda veel hästi kõneleda, aga suutsin palju paremini kui eile.
Ta suutsis lahendada keerulise matemaatilise ülesande.
context: The word 'suutsin' is the first-person singular past tense form of the Estonian verb 'suutma', which means 'to be able to', 'to manage', or 'to succeed'. It indicates that someone had the capability, skill, or opportunity to accomplish something and actually did so in the past. This word emphasizes successful completion of an action where there might have been difficulty involved.
